pageTitle: Itinerary for Wednesday, November 8, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Wednesday, November 8, 2017:

All times local.

Hanoi, Vietnam

10:20 a.m. The Prime Minister will arrive in Hanoi, Vietnam.

Noi Bai International Airport

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity upon arrival

12:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a roundtable discussion with civil society representatives.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

2:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a welcoming ceremony. 

Presidential Palace

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

2:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with the Prime Minister of Vietnam, Nguyễn Xuân Phúc. 

Phong Khach, 1st Floor
Presidential Palace 

Note for media:

  • Official photographers only

3 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold an expanded bilateral meeting with the Prime Minister of Vietnam. 

Main Hall, 2nd Floor
Presidential Palace 

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

4:10 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a joint media availability with the Prime Minister of Vietnam.  

Foyer, 1st Floor
Presidential Palace 

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

4:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will visit the Ho Chi Minh Stilt House.  

Ho Chi Minh Stilt House
So 1 Ngo Bach Thao  

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

5:05 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Secretary General of the Communist Party of Vietnam, Nguyễn Phú Trong.

State Hall, 1st Floor
Headquarters of Communist Party of Vietnam 

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

5:40 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Chair of the National Assembly of Vietnam, Nguyễn Thị Kim Ngân.

National Assembly Building

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

7 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the President of Vietnam, Trần Đại Quang.

Mirror Hall, 1st Floor
Presidential Palace

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

7:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a state banquet and will deliver remarks.

Banquet Hall, 2nd Floor
International Convention Center

Note for media:

  • Open coverage for remarks only
